page.title: 16KIT HILL
page.content: Kit Hill dominates this block, covering 7 of the squares. lOO years ago it was grey with the spoil heaps of tin mining and granite quarrying but today the{industrial past}is covered with heather, gorse and brambles. Several shafts and adits remain, but only one ruined engine house and 3 chimneys. The chimney stack on the summit now carries short-wave aerials. Remains nearby of a banked enclosure are believed to pre-date the mining era. Detailed archaeological investigation has yet to be carried out.Part of the Duchy of Cornwall estate, it has been given to the county by HRH Prince Charles for a {country park.}The public has had access to the hill for many years, although from l928 to l978 a toll was levied by a committee maintaining the road which is now in bad condition.
